title: My birth
content: I was born in Norway, October 21th 1998. My family is from Vietnam and later moved to Norway in the 1970s. So I grew up in a small town called Askim.

title: Korsgård skole
content: Korsgård school was my first primary school that I only went to for 1 year. I met nice people before I moved and left school.

title: Eid skole
content: After 1st grade, I moved and changed primary school to Eid school. We moved to live closer to the school. Here I went 2nd grade to 7th grade.

title: Grøtvedt ungdomsskole
content: When primary school was finished, it was middle school. Here I got new classmates, but still kept the same friends. We went here for 2 years before we had to move to another location.

title: Askim ungdomsskole
content: In 10th grade, many schools merged into one large middle school. This was a brand new school where I went only 1 year.

title: Askim videregående skole
content: In high school, we had to think more about what we want to be in the future. In Norway we also have 13th grade which is the last grade. When I have reached the last grade in high school, I got to celebrate something called the 'Russetiden'.

title: Oslo Metropolitian University
content: Time flew, and I had decided to move from Askim to Oslo to study Bachelor of Information Technology. I found out that I was interested in programming, so I applied to different universities in Oslo.

title: Capgemini Norway
content: After my bachelor's degree, I decided to apply for a job in programming. I finally got the job at Capgemini Norway in Oslo where my position is as a Software Engineer Consultant.
